title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 9 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 9 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: Then Job answered and said,
lineList.cn: 约伯回答说，

lineList.en: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?
lineList.cn: 我真知道是这样。但人在神面前怎能成为义呢。

lineList.en: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.
lineList.cn: 若愿意与他争辩，千中之一也不能回答。

lineList.en: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
lineList.cn: 他心里有智慧，且大有能力。谁向神刚硬而得亨通呢。

lineList.en: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.
lineList.cn: 他发怒，把山翻倒挪移，山并不知觉。

lineList.en: Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.
lineList.cn: 他使地震动，离其本位，地的柱子就摇撼。

lineList.en: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.
lineList.cn: 他吩咐日头不出来，就不出来，又封闭众星。

lineList.en: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.
lineList.cn: 他独自铺张苍天，步行在海浪之上。

lineList.en: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.
lineList.cn: 他造北斗，叁星，昴星，并南方的密宫。

lineList.en: Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.
lineList.cn: 他行大事，不可测度，行奇事，不可胜数。

lineList.en: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.
lineList.cn: 他从我旁边经过，我却不看见。他在我面前行走，我倒不知觉。

lineList.en: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?
lineList.cn: 他夺取，谁能阻挡。谁敢问他，你做什么。

lineList.en: If God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.
lineList.cn: 神必不收回他的怒气。扶助拉哈伯的，屈身在他以下。

lineList.en: How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him?
lineList.cn: 既是这样，我怎敢回答他，怎敢选择言语与他辩论呢。

lineList.en: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.
lineList.cn: 我虽有义，也不回答他。只要向那审判我的恳求。

lineList.en: If I had called, and he had answered me; yet would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.
lineList.cn: 我若呼吁，他应允我。我仍不信他真听我的声音。

lineList.en: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.
lineList.cn: 他用暴风折断我，无故地加增我的损伤。

lineList.en: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.
lineList.cn: 我就是喘一口气，他都不容，倒使我满心苦恼。

lineList.en: If I speak of strength, lo, he is strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?
lineList.cn: 若论力量，他真有能力。若论审判，他说谁能将我传来呢。

lineList.en: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.
lineList.cn: 我虽有义，自己的口要定我为有罪。我虽完全，我口必显我为弯曲。

lineList.en: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.
lineList.cn: 我本完全，不顾自己。我厌恶我的性命。

lineList.en: This is one thing, therefore I said it, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.
lineList.cn: 善恶无分，都是一样。所以我说，完全人和恶人，他都灭绝。

lineList.en: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.
lineList.cn: 若忽然遭杀害之祸，他必戏笑无辜的人遇难。

lineList.en: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where, and who is he?
lineList.cn: 世界交在恶人手中。蒙蔽世界审判官的脸，若不是他，是谁呢。

lineList.en: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.
lineList.cn: 我的日子比跑信的更快，急速过去，不见福乐。

lineList.en: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.
lineList.cn: 我的日子过去如快船，如急落抓食的鹰。

lineList.en: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:
lineList.cn: 我若说，我要忘记我的哀情，除去我的愁容，心中畅快。

lineList.en: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.
lineList.cn: 我因愁苦而惧怕，知道你必不以我为无辜。

lineList.en: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?
lineList.cn: 我必被你定为有罪，我何必徒然劳苦呢。

lineList.en: If I wash myself with snow water, and make my hands never so clean;
lineList.cn: 我若用雪水洗身，用硷洁净我的手。

lineList.en: Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.
lineList.cn: 你还要扔我在坑里，我的衣服都憎恶我。

lineList.en: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.
lineList.cn: 他本不像我是人，使我可以回答他，又使我们可以同听审判。

lineList.en: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, that might lay his hand upon us both.
lineList.cn: 我们中间没有听讼的人，可以向我们两造按手。

lineList.en: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:
lineList.cn: 愿他把杖离开我，不使惊惶威吓我。

lineList.en: Then would I speak, and not fear him; but it is not so with me.
lineList.cn: 我就说话，也不惧怕他，现在我却不是那样。
